channel.title: Log in error
channel.description: I've recently added uuid ban to my source and once I created a new txt file called UUIDBan it no longer allows me to log it by the looks of it my source is running fine and the compiler is fine but it says "error connecting to server" when I try to log in. Any help?

item.title: Log in error
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

Worked on this for a few hours and I fixed it

Read full topic

item.title: Log in error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If the UUID system you implemented is:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/427669-pi-uuid-banning.html
Then remove it.

On some operating systems it won’t generate a UUID (It won’t work for *nix machines due to the C:\ dependencies). I believe there was an issue with some Windows machines not generating ID’s as well.

Proof it is Windows-dependent:
There’s a lot of it, I’ll give one example.
One line in generateUID()

Read full topic

item.title: Log in error
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

portugalrox:

I’ve recently added uuid ban to my source and once I created a new txt file called UUIDBan it no longer allows me to log it by the looks of it my source is running fine and the compiler is fine but it says “error connecting to server” when I try to log in. Any help?

Post the code you’ve added, btw. adding UUID to 317’s is terrible, i wouldn’t prefer that.

justinmperry:

i dont see how making a txt document would do anything, but idk even what uuid is. try to be a little more descriptive, an ‘error connecting to server’ wouldn’t have anything to do with character bans.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier

Read full topic
